reasoning: To achieve this behavior, we need to create a fallback structure that handles two cases: If the robot says 'EXCUSE ME' (gesture code 3), Human 2 should look in the direction of the robot and give way to the robot. If the robot does not say 'EXCUSE ME', Human 2 should stay put and continue the conversation. This behavior tree will consist of one `Fallback` node with two sequences. The first sequence checks if the robot says 'EXCUSE ME' and, if so, makes Human 2 look at the robot and give way to it. The second sequence covers the default behavior (i.e., staying put).
tree:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?>
<root main_tree_to_execute='HumanGivesWayTree'>
    <BehaviorTree ID='HumanGivesWayTree'>
        <Fallback name='GiveWayFallback'>
            <Sequence name='ExcuseMeSequence'>
                <RobotSays agent_id='{id}' message='3'/>
                <LookAtRobot agent_id='{id}' />
                <GiveWaytoRobot agent_id='{id}' time_step='{dt}' />
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name='StayPutSequence'>
                <!-- We can use a NO-OP action to indicate staying put, as no continue conversation action is available -->
                <MakeGesture agent_id='{id}' message='0'/>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>
